result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Spann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit.
Buy Money/Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.  Bail to be refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.
No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependence signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.
Advise any treating physicians of drug use history before being prescribed any medication.  Ingest any of these medications only in the manner prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
All prescriptions to be filled at the same Pharmacy.

Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence 1/19/2018 at 5:00 p.m.  FIRST 45 days to be served, remainder is STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Benedict advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Defendant Maurice Spann in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court previously found the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Benedict makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:

-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

-Inform agent of all prescriptions;

-Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances

-Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent. 

-Advise any treating physicians of drug use history before being prescribed any medications.  Ingest any of these medications only in the manner prescribed.  

-All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy	

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

Condition Time: 120 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence 1/19/18 at 5:00 p.m. First 45 days to be served, remainder is STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

BUY MONEY: $65.00 to be paid to the Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
	
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

$500.00 Cash Bail posted to be returned to poster.

Defendant Maurice Spann in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case to proceed to hearing.  State calls their witness, Det. Tyler Lusmann with the Waukesha Police Dept. Det. Lusmann sworn and testifies on direct.  Cross examination by Atty. Benedict.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony deemed closed.  State has no closing statements and moves to bind over.  Defense has no closing statements and objects to bind over.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Atty. Benedict requests an arraignment date.  Court to set matter for arraignment before the Court Commissioner.  Arraignment scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
